title: Annie dodged all 3 of my Xerath ults by standing completely still...
body:
Seriously.

What kind of mind game is that???

replies.body:
See, this is how low ELOs can win aganist high ELOs.

They are so predictable, they are unpredictable.

This. I always miss Morgana Qs against low elo people because they never try to dodge them. I'm used to shooting them where the enemy will go, rather than aiming at them. It works except when they stand still.
The BunnyFuuFuu predictions dont work in lower elo's i guess...
This is why my Panth ults in ARAM actually hit things. Because I have no idea what I am doing.
Bronze tactics...

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3bIKnUYr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-07-29T16:46:55.051+0000)
>
> See, this is how low ELOs can win aganist high ELOs.
> 
> They are so predictable, they are unpredictable.

Basically how I feel in Rocket League.

Some noobs don't rush the ball but generally when you rush the ball even if you're rushing alone you can't score right away unless you go a certain speed, so they just wait until I rush and then hit it in my goal.

Noobs throw me off.
This is why I can never be madlifed.

Then you mean Kikis is low elo? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7GmR014S2Yc
that "unpredicable" made me remember this video {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Flash + CC on every one of those "unpredictable" ganks.

Soooo unpredictable.

I sometimes mess up my attacking moving and kiting at low elo because I expect people to run away when a Jax jumps on them, so i try to stutter ahead of them but its turns out they just stand there and i actually run out of range briefly trying to lead their escape.

> [{quoted}](name=9001,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3bIKnUYr,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-07-29T16:35:13.710+0000)
>
> Seriously.
> 
> What kind of mind game is that???

I'm thinking a drinking game where you take a shot after every CS.
I love you. My liver hates you though.

i am bronze and still dont have that much alcohol in the house. 
example: 
i shot = 1.5 fl oz. 
lets say we take a bottle of Jaegermeister (coincidentally i have one in my freezer, thus the example)
that's 750 ml =/= 25.5 oz = thats 17 shots

so after 3 waves my precious bottle would be gone (if it was full, which it isnt)

and after 1 bottle of Jaeger i wouldnt hit cs anymore anyways!

i would try it. i played one where i took a shot every time i died as {{champion:268}} . went through half a bottle of bourbon in one game.

i suck at {{champion:268}} .

After every CS? Damn

How about per kills

Every kill = Sip of beer, Double for double kills
Triple, Quadras and Aces = 1 shot
Pentakill = Chug your beer
Roll Nasus on ARAM, buy Targon's.  Watch Brand blow up every wave with his full combo before you can Q.  Finish the game sober.
Goddamnit, play properly so I can counter you!
[Did it look like something this?](http://i.imgur.com/CE8Bp.gif)
My God...The flashbacks are real
it looked exactly like that lol
What the hell "Talent Development Specialist" is even suppose to be?

I love how Wario and Peach just _NOPE_ right off the cliff.

At least Mario tried...
Immobile champs have best mobility at all
League of Immobility is the new League of Mobility.
{{champion:90}} Tell me more
{{item:3431}} soon
"Start moving so I can hit you!" {{champion:101}}
Better nerf Annie.
Scripts lol

HE MUST BE A MASTER!

when in reality his computer lagged a bit.

I've gotten into a really bad habit lately of juking myself by stunning enemies and then firing off my skillshots where they would have been had I not stunned them. It's like OP, except that I defeat myself with mind games.

I do this a lot.{{champion:4}} 
I stun the enemy with a gold card, then I throw my wild cards and miss. =(
can't you just land wild cards by pointing it at them anyway? i can't think of a time i've missed a Q with {{champion:4}}  and i'm a filthy bronzie!
sarcasm?
Where do you think the term "Beginners luck" came from? When your actions are so out of the norm it actually works. But try that twice and get smacked, there is no intermediate luck =)
Reminds me of the Dunkey video where he was Wukong and stood still outside a bush to run away.
Ah... the Wukong "He's Not Moving He Must Be A Clone" trick.... just about as dirty as the Leona taunting to force flashes because it looks JUST LIKE HER FREAKING E WINDUP
I played nid in aram yesterday and i threw spears at people who stood still and i was like WTF Y U NO JUKE when i missed...
I know...its bloody genius, not to mention devious and crafty.
The thing is, Xerath ult isn't really dodgeable if you get them in the center sooooo yeah...
Unless you have very slightly higher than normal movespeed, or a dash,or invincibility, or displacement of any kind, etc.
{{champion:103}} . that is all.

{{champion:238}} {{champion:7}} 

edit: wait, no, nevermind. Sorry, thought this was a mobility contest, forgot Ahri's ult basically counters Xerath's...
The player was from Korea

I have the same problem with Morgana. I always try to lead with my Q and predict which way they'll run or dash. It can take me an embarrassingly long time to adjust to opponents who I actually need to throw straight at since they DON'T break one way or another.
It's not a mind game. It's Lag.

I subvert this.

At first it looks like they failed because I stood still and did not try to dodge.

Then I remember i'm an idiot and I throw myself at the skillshot because reverse reflexes are op and I must collect everything coming my way.

that's exactly how I felt during poro king mode.  

"hey a snow ball....hey a snow ball....hey a snow ball..."
A game where u didnt aim for her

When I played Zed in bronze I had to change how I aim my skillshots because they dont try to dodge skillshots so when you fire em off you just miss.

It's kinda funny tbh.
